overview:
## Discussion

This method applies only to rich text objects.

This method does not include undo support by default. Clients must invoke [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/shouldChangeText(inRanges:replacementStrings:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/shouldChangeText(in:replacementString:)] to include this method in an undoable action.

This method is designed for transferring text from out-of-process sources such as the pasteboard. In most cases, programmatic modification of the text is best done by operating on the text storage directly, using the general methods of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableAttributedString].

# replaceCharacters(in:withRTFD:)

**Instance Method**

Replaces the characters in the given range with RTFD text interpreted from the given RTFD data.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func replaceCharacters(in range: NSRange, withRTFD rtfdData: Data)
```

## Parameters

- **range**: The range of characters to be replaced.
- **rtfdData**: The RTFD data from which to derive the replacement string.

## Discussion

This method applies only to rich text objects.

This method does not include undo support by default. Clients must invoke [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/shouldChangeText(inRanges:replacementStrings:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/shouldChangeText(in:replacementString:)] to include this method in an undoable action.

This method is designed for transferring text from out-of-process sources such as the pasteboard. In most cases, programmatic modification of the text is best done by operating on the text storage directly, using the general methods of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableAttributedString].

## Replacing text

- **replaceCharacters(in:withRTF:)**: Replaces the characters in the given range with RTF text interpreted from the given RTF data.
- **replaceCharacters(in:with:)**: Replaces the characters in the given range with those in the given string.
